trans-unit.source: In the Asset View, click Add asset and select Prefabs > Prefab.
trans-unit.target: In the Asset View, click Add asset and select Prefabs > Prefab.

trans-unit.source: Create a prefab from the Asset View
trans-unit.target: Create a prefab from the Asset View

trans-unit.source: Game Studio creates an empty prefab asset with the default name Prefab. Double-click the asset to open the Prefab Editor and add entities.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio creates an empty prefab asset with the default name Prefab. Double-click the asset to open the Prefab Editor and add entities.

trans-unit.source: Create a prefab from an entity
trans-unit.target: Create a prefab from an entity

trans-unit.source: You can also create a prefab from an existing entity or entities.
trans-unit.target: You can also create a prefab from an existing entity or entities.

trans-unit.source: In the Scene Editor, select the entity or entities you want to create a prefab from.
trans-unit.target: In the Scene Editor, select the entity or entities you want to create a prefab from.

trans-unit.source: !Tip Hold Ctrl to select multiple items.
trans-unit.target: !Tip Hold Ctrl to select multiple items.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the selection and select Create prefab from selection:
trans-unit.target: Right-click the selection and select Create prefab from selection:

trans-unit.source: Game Studio creates a prefab asset from the entity or entities you selected. You can access the new prefab from the Asset View.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio creates a prefab asset from the entity or entities you selected. You can access the new prefab from the Asset View.

trans-unit.source: !Note After you create a prefab from a selection, the original selection itself becomes a prefab.
trans-unit.target: !Note After you create a prefab from a selection, the original selection itself becomes a prefab.

trans-unit.source: Create a prefab from an existing modified prefab
trans-unit.target: Create a prefab from an existing modified prefab

trans-unit.source: You can create new prefabs from modified prefabs. For example, you can instantiate a prefab, override one of its properties, then use this modified prefab instance to create a new prefab.
trans-unit.target: You can create new prefabs from modified prefabs. For example, you can instantiate a prefab, override one of its properties, then use this modified prefab instance to create a new prefab.
